trans-unit.source: Dashboard, Monitor, Scale, Configure, and Hybrid Connections in BizTalk Services | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Dashboard, Monitor, Scale, Configure, and Hybrid Connections in BizTalk Services | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn about the controls and monitor performance on the Management Portal tabs for BizTalk Services: Dashboard, Monitor, Scale, Configure, and Hybrid Connections.
trans-unit.target: Learn about the controls and monitor performance on the Management Portal tabs for BizTalk Services: Dashboard, Monitor, Scale, Configure, and Hybrid Connections.

trans-unit.source: MABS, WABS
trans-unit.target: MABS, WABS

trans-unit.source: Review the Dashboard, Monitor, Scale, Configure, and Hybrid Connection tabs
trans-unit.target: Review the Dashboard, Monitor, Scale, Configure, and Hybrid Connection tabs

trans-unit.source: After you create your BizTalk Service and deploy your application, you can change some of the BizTalk Service settings and monitor the application performance.
trans-unit.target: After you create your BizTalk Service and deploy your application, you can change some of the BizTalk Service settings and monitor the application performance.

trans-unit.source: When you open the Azure Management Portal, you are automatically placed at the **ALL ITEMS** tab.
trans-unit.target: When you open the Azure Management Portal, you are automatically placed at the **ALL ITEMS** tab.

trans-unit.source: To view your BizTalk Service, select your BizTalk Service in the **ALL ITEMS** tab or select the **BIZTALK SERVICES** tab; and then select your BizTalk Service name.
trans-unit.target: To view your BizTalk Service, select your BizTalk Service in the **ALL ITEMS** tab or select the **BIZTALK SERVICES** tab; and then select your BizTalk Service name.

trans-unit.source: This opens a new window with the following tabs.
trans-unit.target: This opens a new window with the following tabs.

trans-unit.source: This topic describes these tabs.
trans-unit.target: This topic describes these tabs.

trans-unit.source: Quick Start (
trans-unit.target: Quick Start (

trans-unit.source: Quick Start
trans-unit.target: Quick Start

trans-unit.source: Depending on the BizTalk Services Edition, all options listed may not be available.
trans-unit.target: Depending on the BizTalk Services Edition, all options listed may not be available.

trans-unit.source: Get the tools
trans-unit.target: Get the tools

trans-unit.source: Learn more about BizTalk Services
trans-unit.target: Learn more about BizTalk Services

trans-unit.source: Go to the learning center to learn more about Azure BizTalk Services.
trans-unit.target: Go to the learning center to learn more about Azure BizTalk Services.

trans-unit.source: In the task bar at the bottom, you can:
trans-unit.target: In the task bar at the bottom, you can:

trans-unit.source: Manage your application deployment
trans-unit.target: Manage your application deployment

trans-unit.source: Opens the Azure BizTalk Services portal.
trans-unit.target: Opens the Azure BizTalk Services portal.

trans-unit.source: The BizTalk Services Portal is the entrance to EDI configuration, including adding partners and creating X12, AS2, and EDIFACT agreements.
trans-unit.target: The BizTalk Services Portal is the entrance to EDI configuration, including adding partners and creating X12, AS2, and EDIFACT agreements.

trans-unit.source: This is the same as Create partner agreements on the Quick Start tab.
trans-unit.target: This is the same as Create partner agreements on the Quick Start tab.

trans-unit.source: Configuring Components for EDI Messaging on BizTalk Services Portal provides more information on the BizTalk Services Portal.
trans-unit.target: Configuring Components for EDI Messaging on BizTalk Services Portal provides more information on the BizTalk Services Portal.

trans-unit.source: Connection Information of the Access Control Namespace
trans-unit.target: Connection Information of the Access Control Namespace

trans-unit.source: When you select Connection Information, then the Access Control Namespace, Default Issuer, and Default Key are displayed.
trans-unit.target: When you select Connection Information, then the Access Control Namespace, Default Issuer, and Default Key are displayed.

trans-unit.source: You can copy these values.
trans-unit.target: You can copy these values.

trans-unit.source: You can also open the Access Control Management Portal.
trans-unit.target: You can also open the Access Control Management Portal.

trans-unit.source: Create an Access control Namespace provides more information on the Access Control Management Portal.
trans-unit.target: Create an Access control Namespace provides more information on the Access Control Management Portal.

trans-unit.source: Sync Keys in the Storage Account
trans-unit.target: Sync Keys in the Storage Account

trans-unit.source: When you create a Storage account, a Primary Key and Secondary Key are automatically created.
trans-unit.target: When you create a Storage account, a Primary Key and Secondary Key are automatically created.

trans-unit.source: These encryption Keys control access to your Storage Account.
trans-unit.target: These encryption Keys control access to your Storage Account.

trans-unit.source: Your BizTalk Service automatically uses the Primary Key.
trans-unit.target: Your BizTalk Service automatically uses the Primary Key.

trans-unit.source: Sync Keys enable users to switch between the Primary Key and the Secondary Key without disrupting the BizTalk Service.
trans-unit.target: Sync Keys enable users to switch between the Primary Key and the Secondary Key without disrupting the BizTalk Service.

trans-unit.source: For example, you want the BizTalk Service to use a new Primary Key for the Storage Account.
trans-unit.target: For example, you want the BizTalk Service to use a new Primary Key for the Storage Account.

trans-unit.source: To do this:
trans-unit.target: To do this:

trans-unit.source: Select your BizTalk Service and select Sync Keys.
trans-unit.target: Select your BizTalk Service and select Sync Keys.

trans-unit.source: Select the Secondary Key.
trans-unit.target: Select the Secondary Key.

trans-unit.source: When you do this, the BizTalk Service starts using the Secondary Key.
trans-unit.target: When you do this, the BizTalk Service starts using the Secondary Key.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure Management Portal, select your Storage account and Regenerate the Primary Key.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure Management Portal, select your Storage account and Regenerate the Primary Key.

trans-unit.source: Remember, your BizTalk Service is using the Secondary Key.
trans-unit.target: Remember, your BizTalk Service is using the Secondary Key.

trans-unit.source: Select your BizTalk Service and select Sync Keys.
trans-unit.target: Select your BizTalk Service and select Sync Keys.

trans-unit.source: Now, select the Primary Key.
trans-unit.target: Now, select the Primary Key.

trans-unit.source: This is the new Primary Key you regenerated.
trans-unit.target: This is the new Primary Key you regenerated.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure Management Portal, select your Storage account and Regenerate the Secondary Key.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure Management Portal, select your Storage account and Regenerate the Secondary Key.

trans-unit.source: This process is called "rollover keys".
trans-unit.target: This process is called "rollover keys".

trans-unit.source: The purpose is to enable users to switch between the Primary Key and the Secondary Key without disrupting the BizTalk Service.
trans-unit.target: The purpose is to enable users to switch between the Primary Key and the Secondary Key without disrupting the BizTalk Service.

trans-unit.source: Delete your application
trans-unit.target: Delete your application

trans-unit.source: When you select Delete, your BizTalk Service and all items deployed to it are removed.
trans-unit.target: When you select Delete, your BizTalk Service and all items deployed to it are removed.

trans-unit.source: Dashboard
trans-unit.target: Dashboard

trans-unit.source: Depending on the BizTalk Services Edition, all options listed may not be available.
trans-unit.target: Depending on the BizTalk Services Edition, all options listed may not be available.

trans-unit.source: When you select your BizTalk Service name, the Dashboard tab is displayed.
trans-unit.target: When you select your BizTalk Service name, the Dashboard tab is displayed.

trans-unit.source: In Dashboard, you can:
trans-unit.target: In Dashboard, you can:

trans-unit.source: Usage Overview: Shows the number of used Hybrid Connections
trans-unit.target: Usage Overview: Shows the number of used Hybrid Connections

trans-unit.source: Also displays the data usage in GB.
trans-unit.target: Also displays the data usage in GB.

trans-unit.source: Metric Graph: Shows a fixed list of performance metrics
trans-unit.target: Metric Graph: Shows a fixed list of performance metrics

trans-unit.source: These metrics provide real-time values regarding the health of the BizTalk Service.
trans-unit.target: These metrics provide real-time values regarding the health of the BizTalk Service.

trans-unit.source: You can also choose the **Relative** or **Absolute** values and the time range **Interval** of the metrics that are displayed in the graph.
trans-unit.target: You can also choose the **Relative** or **Absolute** values and the time range **Interval** of the metrics that are displayed in the graph.

trans-unit.source: For a description of these performance metrics, go to [Available Metrics](#Metrics) in this topic.
trans-unit.target: For a description of these performance metrics, go to [Available Metrics](#Metrics) in this topic.

trans-unit.source: Quick Glance: Lists your BizTalk Service properties
trans-unit.target: Quick Glance: Lists your BizTalk Service properties

trans-unit.source: Update Tracking Database credentials
trans-unit.target: Update Tracking Database credentials

trans-unit.source: Changes the user name and password used to log into the Tracking Database.
trans-unit.target: Changes the user name and password used to log into the Tracking Database.

trans-unit.source: Update SSL Certificate
trans-unit.target: Update SSL Certificate

trans-unit.source: Can update the BizTalk Service to use a different SSL certificate.
trans-unit.target: Can update the BizTalk Service to use a different SSL certificate.

trans-unit.source: A self-signed SSL certificate is automatically created when you create the BizTalk Service.
trans-unit.target: A self-signed SSL certificate is automatically created when you create the BizTalk Service.

trans-unit.source: Download Certificate
trans-unit.target: Download Certificate

trans-unit.source: You can download the SSL certificate used by your BizTalk Service to a local machine.
trans-unit.target: You can download the SSL certificate used by your BizTalk Service to a local machine.

trans-unit.source: Status
trans-unit.target: Status

trans-unit.source: Displays the current status of your BizTalk Service.
trans-unit.target: Displays the current status of your BizTalk Service.

trans-unit.source: See BizTalk Services: Service state chart.
trans-unit.target: See BizTalk Services: Service state chart.

trans-unit.source: Service URL
trans-unit.target: Service URL

trans-unit.source: The URL for your BizTalk Service.
trans-unit.target: The URL for your BizTalk Service.

trans-unit.source: This is the same as the Domain URL entered when your BizTalk Service is created.
trans-unit.target: This is the same as the Domain URL entered when your BizTalk Service is created.

trans-unit.source: Public Virtual IP (VIP) Address
trans-unit.target: Public Virtual IP (VIP) Address

trans-unit.source: The IP address assigned to your BizTalk Service.
trans-unit.target: The IP address assigned to your BizTalk Service.

trans-unit.source: It is used for all input endpoints and is the source address for outbound traffic.
trans-unit.target: It is used for all input endpoints and is the source address for outbound traffic.

trans-unit.source: This IP address belongs to your BizTalk Service as long as it is created.
trans-unit.target: This IP address belongs to your BizTalk Service as long as it is created.

trans-unit.source: If you delete the BizTalk Service, the IP address is assigned to another BizTalk Service.
trans-unit.target: If you delete the BizTalk Service, the IP address is assigned to another BizTalk Service.

trans-unit.source: ACS Namespace
trans-unit.target: ACS Namespace

trans-unit.source: Authenticates with the BizTalk Service.
trans-unit.target: Authenticates with the BizTalk Service.

trans-unit.source: Edition
trans-unit.target: Edition

trans-unit.source: Lists the Edition entered when the BizTalk Service is created.
trans-unit.target: Lists the Edition entered when the BizTalk Service is created.

trans-unit.source: Location
trans-unit.target: Location

trans-unit.source: Displays the geographic region that hosts your BizTalk Service.
trans-unit.target: Displays the geographic region that hosts your BizTalk Service.

trans-unit.source: Created
trans-unit.target: Created

trans-unit.source: Displays the date and time the BizTalk Service was created.
trans-unit.target: Displays the date and time the BizTalk Service was created.

trans-unit.source: Tracking Database
trans-unit.target: Tracking Database

trans-unit.source: The Azure SQL Database name that stores the tracking tables used by your BizTalk Service.
trans-unit.target: The Azure SQL Database name that stores the tracking tables used by your BizTalk Service.

trans-unit.source: Requirements Explained provides details on the Tracking Database.
trans-unit.target: Requirements Explained provides details on the Tracking Database.

trans-unit.source: Monitoring/Archiving Storage
trans-unit.target: Monitoring/Archiving Storage

trans-unit.source: The Azure Storage account name that stores the monitoring output of your BizTalk Service.
trans-unit.target: The Azure Storage account name that stores the monitoring output of your BizTalk Service.

trans-unit.source: Requirements Explained provides details on the Storage account.
trans-unit.target: Requirements Explained provides details on the Storage account.

trans-unit.source: Subscription Name
trans-unit.target: Subscription Name

trans-unit.source: Lists the subscription that hosts your BizTalk Service.
trans-unit.target: Lists the subscription that hosts your BizTalk Service.

trans-unit.source: The subscription governs access to the Azure Management Portal.
trans-unit.target: The subscription governs access to the Azure Management Portal.

trans-unit.source: Subscription ID
trans-unit.target: Subscription ID

trans-unit.source: When a subscription is created, a subscription ID is automatically generated.
trans-unit.target: When a subscription is created, a subscription ID is automatically generated.

trans-unit.source: When using REST APIs, you may need to enter the Subscription ID.
trans-unit.target: When using REST APIs, you may need to enter the Subscription ID.

trans-unit.source: [BizTalk Services: Provisioning Using Azure Management Portal](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkID=302280) lists the steps to create a BizTalk Service.
trans-unit.target: [BizTalk Services: Provisioning Using Azure Management Portal](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkID=302280) lists the steps to create a BizTalk Service.

trans-unit.source: Manage, Connection Information, Sync Keys, and Delete in the task bar:
trans-unit.target: Manage, Connection Information, Sync Keys, and Delete in the task bar:

trans-unit.source: Manage your application deployment
trans-unit.target: Manage your application deployment

trans-unit.source: Opens the Azure BizTalk Services Portal.
trans-unit.target: Opens the Azure BizTalk Services Portal.

trans-unit.source: The BizTalk Services Portal is the entrance to EDI configuration, including adding partners and creating X12, AS2, and EDIFACT agreements.
trans-unit.target: The BizTalk Services Portal is the entrance to EDI configuration, including adding partners and creating X12, AS2, and EDIFACT agreements.

trans-unit.source: This is the same as Create partner agreements on the Quick Start tab.
trans-unit.target: This is the same as Create partner agreements on the Quick Start tab.

trans-unit.source: Configuring Components for EDI Messaging on BizTalk Services Portal provides more information on the BizTalk Services Portal.
trans-unit.target: Configuring Components for EDI Messaging on BizTalk Services Portal provides more information on the BizTalk Services Portal.

trans-unit.source: Connection Information of the Access Control Namespace
trans-unit.target: Connection Information of the Access Control Namespace

trans-unit.source: Displays the Access Control Namespace, Default Issuer, and Default Key values; which can be copied.
trans-unit.target: Displays the Access Control Namespace, Default Issuer, and Default Key values; which can be copied.

trans-unit.source: You can also open the Access Control Management Portal.
trans-unit.target: You can also open the Access Control Management Portal.

trans-unit.source: This Access Control Management Portal is the same as using the Active Directory option in the left navigation pane.
trans-unit.target: This Access Control Management Portal is the same as using the Active Directory option in the left navigation pane.

trans-unit.source: Managing Your ACS Namespace provides more information on the Access Control Management Portal.
trans-unit.target: Managing Your ACS Namespace provides more information on the Access Control Management Portal.

trans-unit.source: Sync Keys in the Storage Account
trans-unit.target: Sync Keys in the Storage Account

trans-unit.source: When you create a Storage account, a Primary Key and Secondary Key are automatically created.
trans-unit.target: When you create a Storage account, a Primary Key and Secondary Key are automatically created.

trans-unit.source: These encryption Keys control access to your Storage Account.
trans-unit.target: These encryption Keys control access to your Storage Account.

trans-unit.source: Your BizTalk Service automatically uses the Primary Key.
trans-unit.target: Your BizTalk Service automatically uses the Primary Key.

trans-unit.source: Sync Keys enable users to switch between the Primary Key and the Secondary Key without disrupting the BizTalk Service.
trans-unit.target: Sync Keys enable users to switch between the Primary Key and the Secondary Key without disrupting the BizTalk Service.

trans-unit.source: For example, you want the BizTalk Service to use a new Primary Key for the Storage Account.
trans-unit.target: For example, you want the BizTalk Service to use a new Primary Key for the Storage Account.

trans-unit.source: To do this:
trans-unit.target: To do this:

trans-unit.source: Select your BizTalk Service and select Sync Keys.
trans-unit.target: Select your BizTalk Service and select Sync Keys.

trans-unit.source: Select the Secondary Key.
trans-unit.target: Select the Secondary Key.

trans-unit.source: When you do this, the BizTalk Service starts using the Secondary Key.
trans-unit.target: When you do this, the BizTalk Service starts using the Secondary Key.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure Management Portal, select your Storage account and Regenerate the Primary Key.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure Management Portal, select your Storage account and Regenerate the Primary Key.

trans-unit.source: Remember, your BizTalk Service is using the Secondary Key.
trans-unit.target: Remember, your BizTalk Service is using the Secondary Key.

trans-unit.source: Select your BizTalk Service and select Sync Keys.
trans-unit.target: Select your BizTalk Service and select Sync Keys.

trans-unit.source: Now, select the Primary Key.
trans-unit.target: Now, select the Primary Key.

trans-unit.source: This is the new Primary Key you regenerated.
trans-unit.target: This is the new Primary Key you regenerated.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure Management Portal, select your Storage account and Regenerate the Secondary Key.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure Management Portal, select your Storage account and Regenerate the Secondary Key.

trans-unit.source: This process is called "rollover keys".
trans-unit.target: This process is called "rollover keys".

trans-unit.source: The purpose is to enable users to switch between the Primary Key and the Secondary Key without disrupting the BizTalk Service.
trans-unit.target: The purpose is to enable users to switch between the Primary Key and the Secondary Key without disrupting the BizTalk Service.

trans-unit.source: Delete your application
trans-unit.target: Delete your application

trans-unit.source: Your BizTalk Service and all items deployed to it are removed.
trans-unit.target: Your BizTalk Service and all items deployed to it are removed.

trans-unit.source: Monitor
trans-unit.target: Monitor

trans-unit.source: Does not apply to the Free Edition.
trans-unit.target: Does not apply to the Free Edition.

trans-unit.source: When you select your BizTalk Service name, the Monitor tab is available and displays the following:
trans-unit.target: When you select your BizTalk Service name, the Monitor tab is available and displays the following:

trans-unit.source: Metric Graph: Displays the selected performance metrics
trans-unit.target: Metric Graph: Displays the selected performance metrics

trans-unit.source: These metrics provide real-time values regarding the health of the BizTalk Service.
trans-unit.target: These metrics provide real-time values regarding the health of the BizTalk Service.

trans-unit.source: You choose which performance metrics are displayed.
trans-unit.target: You choose which performance metrics are displayed.

trans-unit.source: A maximum of six performance metrics can be displayed simultaneously.
trans-unit.target: A maximum of six performance metrics can be displayed simultaneously.

trans-unit.source: You can also choose the **Relative** or **Absolute** values and the time range **Interval** of the metrics that are displayed.
trans-unit.target: You can also choose the **Relative** or **Absolute** values and the time range **Interval** of the metrics that are displayed.

trans-unit.source: To remove or display metrics in the graph:
trans-unit.target: To remove or display metrics in the graph:

trans-unit.source: Select the **Monitor** tab.
trans-unit.target: Select the **Monitor** tab.

trans-unit.source: Select **Add Metrics** in the task bar:
trans-unit.target: Select **Add Metrics** in the task bar:

trans-unit.source: ![Select Add Metrics][AddMetrics]
trans-unit.target: ![Select Add Metrics][AddMetrics]

trans-unit.source: Check the performance metrics you want to display.
trans-unit.target: Check the performance metrics you want to display.

trans-unit.source: Select the checkmark to return to the **Monitor** tab.
trans-unit.target: Select the checkmark to return to the **Monitor** tab.

trans-unit.source: Select the circle next to the metric to display that metric's value in the graph.
trans-unit.target: Select the circle next to the metric to display that metric's value in the graph.

trans-unit.source: For example, the **CPU Usage** metric is grayed out; its output is not displayed in the graph:
trans-unit.target: For example, the **CPU Usage** metric is grayed out; its output is not displayed in the graph:

trans-unit.source: ![CPU Usage metric is grayed out][GrayedMetric]
trans-unit.target: ![CPU Usage metric is grayed out][GrayedMetric]

trans-unit.source: Select the grayed out circle to enable the **CPU Usage** metric to display its output in the graph:
trans-unit.target: Select the grayed out circle to enable the **CPU Usage** metric to display its output in the graph:

trans-unit.source: ![CPU Usage metric is enabled][EnabledMetric]
trans-unit.target: ![CPU Usage metric is enabled][EnabledMetric]

trans-unit.source: To remove a metric from the display graph and the list, select **Delete Metric** in the task bar.
trans-unit.target: To remove a metric from the display graph and the list, select **Delete Metric** in the task bar.

trans-unit.source: To add the metric back to the list, select **Add Metrics** in the task bar, check the metric, and select the checkmark to return to the **Monitor** tab.
trans-unit.target: To add the metric back to the list, select **Add Metrics** in the task bar, check the metric, and select the checkmark to return to the **Monitor** tab.

trans-unit.source: Select the grayed out circle to enable the metric.
trans-unit.target: Select the grayed out circle to enable the metric.

trans-unit.source: Available Metrics
trans-unit.target: Available Metrics

trans-unit.source: The following performance counters/metrics are available:
trans-unit.target: The following performance counters/metrics are available:

trans-unit.source: RountdTrip Latency
trans-unit.target: RountdTrip Latency

trans-unit.source: Displays the average time taken in milliseconds (ms) to process a message from the time the message is received until the message is fully processed by the BizTalk Service across all bridges.
trans-unit.target: Displays the average time taken in milliseconds (ms) to process a message from the time the message is received until the message is fully processed by the BizTalk Service across all bridges.

trans-unit.source: Only messages successfully processed are counted.
trans-unit.target: Only messages successfully processed are counted.

trans-unit.source: When the following events occur, a timestamp is created:
trans-unit.target: When the following events occur, a timestamp is created:

trans-unit.source: Message enters the gateway
trans-unit.target: Message enters the gateway

trans-unit.source: Message is routed to the destination
trans-unit.target: Message is routed to the destination

trans-unit.source: Destination response is received
trans-unit.target: Destination response is received

trans-unit.source: Destination acknowledgement response sent to the gateway
trans-unit.target: Destination acknowledgement response sent to the gateway

trans-unit.source: This metric shows the result of the following calculation:
trans-unit.target: This metric shows the result of the following calculation:

trans-unit.source: [Destination acknowledgement response sent to the gateway] - [Message enters the gateway]
trans-unit.target: [Destination acknowledgement response sent to the gateway] - [Message enters the gateway]

trans-unit.source: Failures At Source
trans-unit.target: Failures At Source

trans-unit.source: Displays the total number of messages that failed by the BizTalk Service when pulling messages from the source endpoints.
trans-unit.target: Displays the total number of messages that failed by the BizTalk Service when pulling messages from the source endpoints.

trans-unit.source: CPU Usage
trans-unit.target: CPU Usage

trans-unit.source: Lists the average %Processor Time of all role instances.
trans-unit.target: Lists the average %Processor Time of all role instances.

trans-unit.source: Processing Latency
trans-unit.target: Processing Latency

trans-unit.source: Displays the average time taken In milliseconds (ms) to process a message by the BizTalk Service across all bridges, excluding the time spent in destinations.
trans-unit.target: Displays the average time taken In milliseconds (ms) to process a message by the BizTalk Service across all bridges, excluding the time spent in destinations.

trans-unit.source: Only messages successfully processed are counted.
trans-unit.target: Only messages successfully processed are counted.

trans-unit.source: When each of the following events occur, a timestamp is created:
trans-unit.target: When each of the following events occur, a timestamp is created:

trans-unit.source: Message enters the gateway
trans-unit.target: Message enters the gateway

trans-unit.source: Message is routed to the destination
trans-unit.target: Message is routed to the destination

trans-unit.source: Destination response is received
trans-unit.target: Destination response is received

trans-unit.source: Destination acknowledgement response sent to the gateway
trans-unit.target: Destination acknowledgement response sent to the gateway

trans-unit.source: This metric shows the result of the following calculation:
trans-unit.target: This metric shows the result of the following calculation:

trans-unit.source: [Destination acknowledgement response sent to the gateway] - [Message enters the gateway] - [Destination response is received] + [Message is routed to the destination]
trans-unit.target: [Destination acknowledgement response sent to the gateway] - [Message enters the gateway] - [Destination response is received] + [Message is routed to the destination]

trans-unit.source: Failures In Process
trans-unit.target: Failures In Process

trans-unit.source: Displays the total number of messages that failed during processing by the BizTalk Service across all the bridges within a time interval.
trans-unit.target: Displays the total number of messages that failed during processing by the BizTalk Service across all the bridges within a time interval.

trans-unit.source: Messages Sent
trans-unit.target: Messages Sent

trans-unit.source: Displays the total number of messages sent by the BizTalk Service across all bridges within a time interval.
trans-unit.target: Displays the total number of messages sent by the BizTalk Service across all bridges within a time interval.

trans-unit.source: This metric is incremented when a message sent from a pipeline reaches the route destination.
trans-unit.target: This metric is incremented when a message sent from a pipeline reaches the route destination.

trans-unit.source: This metric does not indicate that a message is successfully processed.
trans-unit.target: This metric does not indicate that a message is successfully processed.

trans-unit.source: In a Request-Reply scenario, the metric is incremented when the route destination sends a receipt acknowledgement back to the pipeline.
trans-unit.target: In a Request-Reply scenario, the metric is incremented when the route destination sends a receipt acknowledgement back to the pipeline.

trans-unit.source: Messages Received
trans-unit.target: Messages Received

trans-unit.source: Displays the total number of messages received by the BizTalk Service across all bridges within a time interval.
trans-unit.target: Displays the total number of messages received by the BizTalk Service across all bridges within a time interval.

trans-unit.source: This metric is incremented when a new message is received by the pipeline.
trans-unit.target: This metric is incremented when a new message is received by the pipeline.

trans-unit.source: Messages In Process
trans-unit.target: Messages In Process

trans-unit.source: Displays the total number of messages currently being processed by the BizTalk Service within a time interval.
trans-unit.target: Displays the total number of messages currently being processed by the BizTalk Service within a time interval.

trans-unit.source: Messages Processed
trans-unit.target: Messages Processed

trans-unit.source: Displays the total number of messages successfully processed by the BizTalk Service across all bridges within a time interval.
trans-unit.target: Displays the total number of messages successfully processed by the BizTalk Service across all bridges within a time interval.

trans-unit.source: This metric is incremented when a message is successfully received by the pipeline and successfully routed to the destination.
trans-unit.target: This metric is incremented when a message is successfully received by the pipeline and successfully routed to the destination.

trans-unit.source: Scale
trans-unit.target: Scale

trans-unit.source: In the Scale tab, you can add or subtract the number of units used by your BizTalk Service.
trans-unit.target: In the Scale tab, you can add or subtract the number of units used by your BizTalk Service.

trans-unit.source: By default, there is one Unit configured.
trans-unit.target: By default, there is one Unit configured.

trans-unit.source: Additional Units can be added to scale your BizTalk Service.
trans-unit.target: Additional Units can be added to scale your BizTalk Service.

trans-unit.source: When you increase the scale, you are increasing throughput.
trans-unit.target: When you increase the scale, you are increasing throughput.

trans-unit.source: The amount of resources also increases, including deployed bridges, agreements, LOB connections, and processing power.
trans-unit.target: The amount of resources also increases, including deployed bridges, agreements, LOB connections, and processing power.

trans-unit.source: For example, you increase the scale from 1 Unit to 2 Units.
trans-unit.target: For example, you increase the scale from 1 Unit to 2 Units.

trans-unit.source: In this situation, you can deploy double the number of bridges, double the agreements, double the LOB connections, and double the processing power.
trans-unit.target: In this situation, you can deploy double the number of bridges, double the agreements, double the LOB connections, and double the processing power.

trans-unit.source: Some BizTalk editions do not offer a scale option.
trans-unit.target: Some BizTalk editions do not offer a scale option.

trans-unit.source: In this situation, one Unit is permitted.
trans-unit.target: In this situation, one Unit is permitted.

trans-unit.source: To determine how many units your edition can be scaled, refer to [BizTalk Services: Editions Chart](biztalk-editions-feature-chart.md).
trans-unit.target: To determine how many units your edition can be scaled, refer to [BizTalk Services: Editions Chart](biztalk-editions-feature-chart.md).

trans-unit.source: Increasing the number of units may impact pricing.
trans-unit.target: Increasing the number of units may impact pricing.

trans-unit.source: If you increase the Units, selecting **Save** displays a message that tells you if billing is impacted.
trans-unit.target: If you increase the Units, selecting **Save** displays a message that tells you if billing is impacted.

trans-unit.source: You then choose to continue.
trans-unit.target: You then choose to continue.

trans-unit.source: When you increase the number of Units, the BizTalk Service status changes from Active to Updating.
trans-unit.target: When you increase the number of Units, the BizTalk Service status changes from Active to Updating.

trans-unit.source: In the Updating state, your BizTalk Service continues to run.
trans-unit.target: In the Updating state, your BizTalk Service continues to run.

trans-unit.source: [BizTalk Services: Editions Chart](biztalk-editions-feature-chart.md) defines a "Unit".
trans-unit.target: [BizTalk Services: Editions Chart](biztalk-editions-feature-chart.md) defines a "Unit".

trans-unit.source: Configure
trans-unit.target: Configure

trans-unit.source: Does not apply to Hybrid Connections.
trans-unit.target: Does not apply to Hybrid Connections.

trans-unit.source: Sets the Backup Status to None or Automatic.
trans-unit.target: Sets the Backup Status to None or Automatic.

trans-unit.source: When set to None, no backups are automatically created.
trans-unit.target: When set to None, no backups are automatically created.

trans-unit.source: When set to Automatic, you configure the backup location, the frequency of the backup, and how long to keep the backup files.
trans-unit.target: When set to Automatic, you configure the backup location, the frequency of the backup, and how long to keep the backup files.

trans-unit.source: [BizTalk Services: Backup and Restore](biztalk-backup-restore.md) provides the details.
trans-unit.target: [BizTalk Services: Backup and Restore](biztalk-backup-restore.md) provides the details.

trans-unit.source: Hybrid Connections
trans-unit.target: Hybrid Connections

trans-unit.source: Hybrid Connections connect an Azure application, like Websites or Mobile Services, to an on-premises resource that uses a static TCP port, such as SQL Server, MySQL, HTTP Web APIs, and most custom Web Services.
trans-unit.target: Hybrid Connections connect an Azure application, like Websites or Mobile Services, to an on-premises resource that uses a static TCP port, such as SQL Server, MySQL, HTTP Web APIs, and most custom Web Services.

trans-unit.source: Hybrid Connections are managed in BizTalk Services in the Azure Management Portal.
trans-unit.target: Hybrid Connections are managed in BizTalk Services in the Azure Management Portal.

trans-unit.source: To create Hybrid Connections in Azure Websites, see [Hybrid Connection: Connect an Azure Web Site to an On-Premises Resource](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=397538).
trans-unit.target: To create Hybrid Connections in Azure Websites, see [Hybrid Connection: Connect an Azure Web Site to an On-Premises Resource](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=397538).

trans-unit.source: To use Hybrid Connections in Azure Mobile Services, see [Azure Mobile Services and Hybrid Connections](../mobile-services-dotnet-backend-hybrid-connections-get-started.md).
trans-unit.target: To use Hybrid Connections in Azure Mobile Services, see [Azure Mobile Services and Hybrid Connections](../mobile-services-dotnet-backend-hybrid-connections-get-started.md).

trans-unit.source: To create or manage Hybrid Connections in Azure BizTalk Services, see [Hybrid Connections](integration-hybrid-connection-overview.md).
trans-unit.target: To create or manage Hybrid Connections in Azure BizTalk Services, see [Hybrid Connections](integration-hybrid-connection-overview.md).
